title: United Nations Security Council Resolution 1151
text:
United Nations Security Council resolution 1151, adopted unanimously on 30 January 1998, after recalling previous <a href="United%20Nations%20Security%20Council%20resolution">resolutions</a> on <a href="Israel">Israel</a> and <a href="Lebanon">Lebanon</a> including <a href="United%20Nations%20Security%20Council%20Resolution%20501">501</a> (1982), <a href="United%20Nations%20Security%20Council%20Resolution%20508">508</a> (1982), <a href="United%20Nations%20Security%20Council%20Resolution%20509">509</a> (1982) and <a href="United%20Nations%20Security%20Council%20Resolution%20520">520</a> (1982) as well as studying the report by the <a href="Secretary-General%20of%20the%20United%20Nations">Secretary-General</a> on the <a href="United%20Nations%20Interim%20Force%20in%20Lebanon">United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon</a> (UNIFIL) approved in <a href="United%20Nations%20Security%20Council%20Resolution%20426">426</a> (1978), the Council decided to extend the mandate of UNIFIL for a further six months until 31 July 1998.
The Council then reemphasised the mandate of the Force and requested the Secretary-General to continue negotiations with the <a href="Government%20of%20Lebanon">Government of Lebanon</a> and other parties concerned with regards to the implementation of resolutions <a href="United%20Nations%20Security%20Council%20Resolution%20425">425</a> (1978) and 426 (1978) and report thereon.
All violence against UNIFIL was condemned with the parties urged to put a stop to attacks on the Force. The Secretary-General <a href="Kofi%20Annan">Kofi Annan</a> had reported that tension had increased in the region, with 34 casualties compared to 9 in the previous reporting period; it had also recorded 249 operations or attacks against the <a href="Israeli%20Defense%20Forces">Israeli Defense Forces</a> and <a href="South%20Lebanon%20Army">South Lebanon Army</a>. Further efficiency savings were encouraged provided they did not affect the operational capacity of the operation.
